Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates by stating that House Democrats are striking to implement Sharia law, when in reality there was no strike and the resolution introduced was non-binding and aimed at addressing anti-Muslim sentiment.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as there is no evidence provided to substantiate the assertion that House Democrats are trying to implement Sharia law.
Problematic assumption: The claim makes a problematic assumption that the resolution introduced by House Democrats is an attempt to implement Sharia law, when in fact it seeks to protect the civil rights and liberties of all citizens, including Muslims.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that the resolution introduced by House Democrats did not seek to institute Sharia law, as it was non-binding and aimed at denouncing hate crimes and persecution.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim does not consider alternative explanations for the purpose of the resolution, such as addressing anti-Muslim sentiment and protecting civil rights and liberties.
